metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0566 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It may be possible for an attacker to craft an email message that causes Thunderbird to perform an out-of-bounds write of one byte when processing the message. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.6.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
